p: The studied metals were not efficiently translocated in aerial parts of plants. The TF values were below 1, indicating a non-efficient translocation of metals between organs ( Figure 11 and Figure 12). Ni translocation from root to stem increased comparing with Pb in the AsCdNiPb experiment. This indicates the Ni utilization in plant nutrition. Cd translocation in stem was superior in the AsCdNiPb experiment as in case of the AsCd experiment, but it was not significant.
